thread.title: National Television Awards 2017: Ant and Dec win big as Mary Berry beats Len Goodman and Casualty trumps Game of Thrones
thread.title_full: National Television Awards 2017: Ant and Dec win big as Mary Berry beats Len Goodman and Casualty trumps Game of Thrones

author: Emma Powell
title: National Television Awards 2017: Ant and Dec win big as Mary Berry beats Len Goodman and Casualty trumps Game of Thrones
text:
Mrs Brown’s Boys was crowned Comedy champion, Call The Midwife picked up the first ever Period Drama trophy and Emmerdale picked up the coveted Serial Drama gong. 
Graham Norton was honoured with the Special Recognition award for his services to TV. 
On accepting the accolade, Norton joked: “I know this is a sort of NTA pity party because it’s the only way I can get one of these over Ant and Dec. I feel so old. I feel like the NTAs have invited me to my own funeral –turns out it was great Will Smith and my mother were there.” 
He continued: “I don’t quite know what to say because legions of people have worked on the show over the years and I can’t thank them all. Thank you to all of you who watch the show. I’m glad you still enjoy it after nearly 20 years. To keep a show on the air for that long isn’t easy – in my case it’s kind of a miracle. I’ve been very lucky to work with amazing people over the years.” 
Norton fought back tears as he thanked his close group of representatives for ‘keeping him on TV’. 
Full list of winners: 
Ant & Dec's Saturday night Takeaway 
Drama Performance
